sentences.text: NOTICE OF ANNUAL MEETING OF STOCKHOLDERS To Be Held April 12, 2017
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Dear Stockholders:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You are cordially invited to attend our 2017 Annual Meeting of Stockholders to be held on Wednesday, April 12, 2017 at 9:00 a.m. local time at our Almaden Tower building located at 151 Almaden Boulevard, San Jose, California 95110.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We are holding the meeting to:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 1. Elect ten members of our Board of Directors named herein to serve for a one-year term;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2. Approve the 2003 Equity Incentive Plan as amended to increase the available share reserve by 10 million shares;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 3. Ratify the appointment of KPMG LLP as our independent registered public accounting firm for our fiscal year ending on December 1, 2017;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 4. Approve, on an advisory basis, the compensation of our named executive officers;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 5. Approve, on an advisory basis, the frequency of the advisory vote on executive compensation; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Transact any other business that may properly come before the meeting
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you owned our common stock at the close of business on February 14, 2017, you may attend and vote at the meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A list of stockholders eligible to vote at the meeting will be available for review during our regular business hours at our headquarters in San Jose, California for the ten days prior to the meeting for any purpose related to the meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We are pleased to continue to take advantage of the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission rule that allows companies to furnish proxy materials to their stockholders over the Internet.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As a result, we are mailing to most of our stockholders a Notice of Internet Availability of Proxy Materials (the Notice) instead of a paper copy of this proxy statement and our 2016 Annual Report.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe that this process allows us to provide our stockholders with the information they need in a timelier manner, while reducing the environmental impact and lowering the costs of printing and distributing our proxy materials.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Notice contains instructions on how to access those documents over the Internet.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Notice also contains instructions on how to request a paper copy of our proxy materials, including this proxy statement, our 2016 Annual Report and a form of proxy card.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All stockholders who have previously requested a paper copy of our proxy materials will continue to receive a paper copy of the proxy materials by mail.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Your vote is important.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Whether or not you plan to attend the meeting, we hope that you will vote as soon as possible.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You may vote your shares via a toll-free telephone number or over the Internet.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you received a proxy card or voting instruction card by mail, you may submit your proxy card or voting instruction card by signing, dating and mailing your proxy card or voting instruction card in the envelope provided.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Sincerely,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Michael Dillon Executive Vice President, General Counsel & Corporate Secretary

sentences.text: PROXY STATEMENT
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: INFORMATION CONCERNING SOLICITATION AND VOTING
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Board of Directors (the Board) is soliciting proxies for our 2017 Annual Meeting of Stockholders (the 2017 Annual Meeting) to be held on Wednesday, April 12, 2017, at 9:00 a.m. local time at our Almaden Tower building located at 151 Almaden Boulevard, San Jose, California 95110.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our principal executive offices are located at 345 Park Avenue, San Jose, California 95110, and our telephone number is (408) 536-6000.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The proxy materials, including this proxy statement, proxy card and our 2016 Annual Report, are being distributed and made available on or about March 3, 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This proxy statement contains important information for you to consider when deciding how to vote on the matters brought before the 2017 Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Please read it carefully.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In accordance with rules and regulations adopted by the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission (the SEC), we have elected to provide our stockholders access to our proxy materials over the Internet.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Accordingly, a Notice of Internet Availability of Proxy Materials (the Notice) will be mailed on or about March 3, 2017 to most of our stockholders who owned our common stock at the close of business on the record date, February 14, 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stockholders will have the ability to access the proxy materials on a website referred to in the Notice or request a printed set of the proxy materials be sent to them by following the instructions in the Notice.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Notice will also provide instructions on how you can elect to receive future proxy materials electronically or in printed form by mail.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you choose to receive future proxy materials electronically, you will receive an email next year with instructions containing a link to the proxy materials and a link to the proxy voting site.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Your election to receive proxy materials electronically or in printed form by mail will remain in effect until you terminate such election.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Choosing to receive future proxy materials electronically will allow us to provide you with the information you need in a timelier manner, will save us the cost of printing and mailing documents to you and will conserve natural resources.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We will bear the expense of soliciting proxies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition to these proxy materials, our directors and employees (who will receive no compensation in addition to their regular salaries) may solicit proxies in person, by telephone or email.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We have also retained Innisfree M&A Incorporated to help us solicit proxies from brokers, bank nominees and other institutional owners.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We expect to pay Innisfree a fee of $15,000 for its services and will reimburse Innisfree for reasonable out-of-pocket expenses.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We will reimburse banks, brokers and other custodians, nominees and fiduciaries for reasonable charges and expenses incurred in forwarding soliciting materials to their clients.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: QUESTIONS AND ANSWERS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Q: Who may vote at the 2017 Annual Meeting?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A: Our Board set February 14, 2017 as the record date for the meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you owned our common stock at the close of business on February 14, 2017, you may attend and vote at the meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each stockholder is entitled to one vote for each share of common stock held on all matters to be voted on.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As of February 14, 2017, there were 495,671,898 shares of our common stock outstanding and entitled to vote at the meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Q: What is the quorum requirement for the 2017 Annual Meeting?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A: A majority of our outstanding shares entitled to vote as of the record date must be present at the meeting in order to hold the meeting and conduct business.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This is called a quorum.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Your shares will be counted as present at the meeting if you are entitled to vote and you:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: are present in person at the meeting; or
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: have properly submitted a proxy card or voting instruction card, or voted by telephone or over the Internet.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Both abstentions and broker non-votes (as described below) are counted for the purpose of determining the presence of a quorum.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each proposal identifies the votes needed to approve or ratify the proposed action.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Q: What proposals will be voted on at the 2017 Annual Meeting?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A: There are five proposals scheduled to be voted on at the meeting:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Election of ten members of our Board named herein to serve for a one-year term;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Approval of the 2003 Equity Incentive Plan as amended to increase the available share reserve by 10 million shares;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Ratification of the appointment of KPMG LLP as our independent registered public accounting firm for the fiscal year ending December 1, 2017;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Approval, on an advisory basis, of the compensation of our named executive officers; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Approval, on an advisory basis, on the frequency of the advisory vote on executive compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We will also consider any other business that properly comes before the meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If any other matters are properly brought before the meeting, the persons named in the enclosed proxy card or voter instruction card will vote the shares they represent using their best judgment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Q: Why did I receive a notice in the mail regarding the Internet availability of proxy materials instead of a full set of proxy materials?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A: We are pleased to continue to take advantage of the SEC rule that allows companies to furnish their proxy materials over the Internet.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Accordingly, we have sent to most of our stockholders of record and beneficial owners a notice regarding Internet availability of proxy materials.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Instructions on how to access the proxy materials over the Internet or to request a paper copy may be found in the Notice.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, stockholders may request to receive proxy materials in printed form by mail or electronically on an ongoing basis.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A stockholders election to receive proxy materials by mail or electronically by email will remain in effect until the stockholder terminates such election.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Q: Why did I receive a full set of proxy materials in the mail instead of a notice regarding the Internet availability of proxy materials?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A: We are providing stockholders who have previously requested to receive paper copies of the proxy materials with paper copies of the proxy materials instead of a Notice.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you would like to reduce the environmental impact and the costs incurred by us in mailing proxy materials, you may elect to receive all future proxy materials electronically via email or the Internet.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To sign up for electronic delivery, please follow the instructions provided with your proxy materials and on your proxy card or voting instruction card, to vote using the Internet and, when prompted, indicate that you agree to receive or access stockholder communications electronically in future years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Alternatively, you can go to https://www.icsdelivery.com/adobe and enroll for online delivery of annual meeting and proxy voting materials.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Q: How can I get electronic access to the proxy materials?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A: You can view the proxy materials on the Internet at www.proxyvote.com.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Please have your 12 digit control number available.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Your 12 digit control number can be found on your Notice.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you received a paper copy of your proxy materials, your 12 digit control number can be found on your proxy card or voting instruction card.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our proxy materials are also available on our Investor Relations website at www.adobe.com/adbe
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Q: Can I vote my shares by filling out and returning the Notice?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A: No.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Notice will, however, provide instructions on how to vote by Internet, by telephone, by requesting and returning a paper proxy card or voting instruction card, or by submitting a ballot in person at the meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Q: How may I vote my shares in person at the meeting?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A: If your shares are registered directly in your name with our transfer agent, Broadridge Corporate Issuer Solutions, Inc., you are considered, with respect to those shares, the stockholder of record.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As the stockholder of record, you have the right to vote in person at the meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If your shares are held in a brokerage account or by another nominee or trustee, you are considered the beneficial owner of shares held in street name.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As the beneficial owner, you are also invited to attend the meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Since a beneficial owner is not the stockholder of record, you may not vote these shares in person at the meeting unless you obtain a legal proxy from your broker, nominee, or trustee that holds your shares, giving you the right to vote the shares at the meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The meeting will be held at our Almaden Tower building located at 151 Almaden Boulevard, San Jose, California 95110.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you need directions to the meeting, please visit http://www.adobe.com/aboutadobe/pdfs/sjmap.pdf.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Q: How can I vote my shares without attending the meeting?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A: Whether you hold shares directly as a registered stockholder of record or beneficially in street name, you may vote without attending the meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You may vote by granting a proxy or, for shares held beneficially in street name, by submitting voting instructions to your broker, trustee or nominee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In most cases, you will be able to do this by telephone, by using the Internet or by mail if you received a printed set of the proxy materials.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: By Telephone or Internet.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you have telephone or Internet access, you may submit your proxy by following the instructions provided in the Notice, or if you received a printed version of the proxy materials by mail, by following the instructions provided with your proxy materials and on your proxy card or voting instruction card.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Delaware law specifically permits electronically transmitted proxies as long as they contain or are submitted with information from which the inspector of elections can determine that the proxy was authorized by the stockholder.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Internet voting procedures for the 2017 Annual Meeting are designed to authenticate each stockholder by use of a control number to allow stockholders to vote their shares and to confirm that their instructions have been properly recorded.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: By Mail.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you received printed proxy materials, you may submit your proxy by mail by signing your proxy card if your shares are registered or, for shares held beneficially in street name, by following the voting instructions included by your stockbroker, trustee or nominee, and mailing it in the enclosed envelope.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you provide specific voting instructions, your shares will be voted as you have instructed.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Q: What happens if I do not give specific voting instructions?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A: Registered Stockholder of Record.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you are a registered stockholder of record and you indicate when voting on the Internet or by telephone that you wish to vote as recommended by the Board, or you sign, date and return a proxy card without giving specific voting instructions, then the proxy holders will vote your shares in the manner recommended by the Board on all matters presented in this proxy statement and as the proxy holders may determine in their best judgment with respect to any other matters properly presented for a vote at the meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Beneficial Owners of Shares Held in Street Name.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you are a beneficial owner of shares held in street name and do not provide the organization that holds your shares with specific voting instructions, the organization that holds your shares may generally vote at its discretion on routine matters but cannot vote on non-routine matters.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If the organization that holds your shares does not receive instructions from you on how to vote your shares on a non-routine matter, the organization will inform the inspector of elections that it does not have the authority to vote on this matter with respect to your shares.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This is generally referred to as a broker non-vote.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In tabulating the voting results for any particular proposal, shares that constitute broker non- votes are not considered entitled to vote on that proposal.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Thus, broker non-votes will not affect the outcome of any matter being voted on at the meeting, assuming that a quorum is obtained.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Q: Which ballot measures are considered routine or non-routine?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A: The ratification of the appointment of KPMG LLP as our independent registered public accounting firm for the fiscal year ending December 1, 2017 (Proposal 3), is considered routine under applicable rules.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A broker or other nominee may generally vote on routine matters, and therefore no broker non-votes are expected to exist in connection with Proposal 3.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The election of directors (Proposal 1), the approval of the 2003 Equity Incentive Plan as amended to increase the available share reserve by 10 million shares (Proposal 2), the advisory vote on executive compensation (Proposal 4), and the advisory vote on the frequency of the advisory vote on executive compensation (Proposal 5) are matters considered non-routine under applicable rules.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A broker or other nominee cannot vote without instructions on non-routine matters, and, therefore, there may be broker non-votes on Proposals 1, 2, 4 and 5.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Q: How can I revoke my proxy and change my vote?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A: You may revoke your proxy and change your vote at any time before the final vote at the meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you are a stockholder of record, you may do this by signing and submitting a new proxy card with a later date; by voting by telephone or by using the Internet, either of which must be completed by 11:59 p.m.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Eastern Time on April 11, 2017 (your latest telephone or Internet proxy is counted); or by attending the meeting and voting in person by ballot.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Attending the meeting alone will not revoke your proxy unless you specifically request your proxy to be revoked.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you hold shares through a bank or brokerage firm, you must contact that bank or firm directly to revoke any prior voting instructions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Q: Where can I find the voting results of the meeting?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A: The preliminary voting results will be announced at the meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The final voting results will be reported in a Current Report on Form 8-K, which will be filed with the SEC within four business days after the meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If our final voting results are not available within four business days after the meeting, we will file a Current Report on Form 8-K reporting the preliminary voting results and subsequently file the final voting results in an amendment to the Current Report on Form 8-K within four business days after the final voting results are known to us.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Barnholt holds a B.S. and a M.S. in Electrical Engineering from Stanford University.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As the former President, Chief Executive Officer and Chairman of the Board of Agilent, as well as a former senior executive with Hewlett-Packard, Mr. Barnholt possesses significant leadership and operational experience, including on matters particularly relevant to companies with complex
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: technology and international issues.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As a board member of two other public companies and a chairman of one of those companies, Mr. Barnholt also has strong corporate governance expertise and a global business perspective.

sentences.text: Risk Analysis of Performance-Based Compensation Plans
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Executive Compensation Committee believes that our employee compensation programs do not encourage excessive and unnecessary risk-taking that would be reasonably likely to have a material adverse effect on Adobe.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Executive Compensation Committee oversaw the performance of a risk assessment of our compensation programs as generally applicable to our employees to ascertain any potential material risks that may be created by our compensation programs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Executive Compensation Committee considered the findings of the assessment conducted internally and concluded that our compensation programs are designed and administered with the appropriate balance of risk and reward in relation to our overall business strategy and do not encourage employees to take unnecessary or excessive risks, and that the level of risk that they might encourage is not reasonably likely to materially harm our business or financial condition, after considering mitigating controls.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Additionally, the Audit Committee considered the risk assessment and the findings of the Executive Compensation Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Although the majority of target total direct compensation provided to our executive officers is incentive based, the Executive Compensation Committee believes that our executive compensation programs have been designed with appropriate controls and other mitigating measures to prevent excessive and unnecessary risk taking.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Incentive-based employee compensation programs typically make up a smaller percentage of our other employees overall compensation and therefore provide less motivation for risk taking.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The design of these compensation programs is intended to encourage our employees to remain focused on both short- and long-term operational and financial goals of the company in several key respects:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: While our Executive Incentive Plans for fiscal years 2016 and 2017 focus on the achievement of bookings and recurring revenue targets and strategic objectives relating to customer experience, they also include an individual performance component with objectives for many of our executives relating to operating metrics; together with our long-term equity incentive programs that motivate our executives to build stockholder value, our fiscal year 2016 and 2017 compensation programs (which are described further below in the Compensation Discussion and Analysis section of this proxy statement) continue to provide balanced objectives while driving our short- and long-term business strategies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Performance Share Program is based on Adobes total stockholder return (TSR) over a three-year period relative to the companies in the NASDAQ 100 Index, so unlike stock options, the program will not reward short-term spikes in the price of our stock, but instead requires sustained, measurable performance over a three-year period.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In the event Adobes TSR places in the bottom 25% relative to the companies in the NASDAQ 100 Index, no shares will be awarded, meaning our executives will be rewarded only when Adobes stock is performing relative to the market.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our system of internal controls over financial reporting, standards of business conduct and compliance programs, among other things, reduces the likelihood of manipulation of our financial performance to enhance payments under our bonus and sales compensation plans.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Board Leadership Structure
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each year, our Board evaluates whether its leadership structure is appropriate to effectively address the specific needs of our business and the long-term interests of our stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Given the dynamic and competitive environment in which Adobe operates, the Board believes that Adobe and our stockholders are best served by a Chairman who has broad and deep knowledge of Adobes business operations and the competitive landscape, the ability to identify strategic issues and the vision to create sustainable long-term value for stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Based on these considerations, the Board has determined that, at this time, our Chief Executive Officer,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shantanu Narayen, is the director best qualified to serve in the role of Chairman.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board believes that Mr. Narayens combined role enables decisive leadership, ensures clear accountability and enhances the Boards ability to focus its meetings on the issues most critical to Adobes success, as
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To maintain an appropriate level of independent checks and balances in our corporate governance, our Corporate Governance Guidelines provide that if the Chairman of the Board and the Chief Executive Officer are the same person, the independent members of the Board will annually select an independent director to serve in a lead capacity, who we refer to as our Lead Director.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Board believes that there are advantages to having a Lead Director for matters such as communications and relations among our Board, the Chief Executive Officer and other members of senior management and in assisting our Board in reaching consensus on particular strategies and policies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The independent members of our Board have selected James Daley to serve as Lead Director.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Lead Director coordinates the activities of the other independent directors and has the following additional responsibilities, as outlined in a Lead Director Charter adopted by the Board and available on our website at http://www.adobe.com/investor-relations/governance.html:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: presiding at all meetings of the Board at which the Chairman is not present, including executive sessions of the independent directors;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: working to optimize Board performance through regular feedback that ensures that diverse viewpoints of all directors are heard, and creating a climate of constructive candor in which frank and thoughtful discussion occurs;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: meeting with the Chairman and Chief Executive Officer to discuss Board agendas, materials and the schedule of meetings;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: calling meetings of the independent directors, as needed;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: providing feedback to directors in connection with the periodic evaluation process;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: administering, with the Chair of the Executive Compensation Committee, the Boards evaluation of the performance of the Chairman and Chief Executive Officer; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: making himself available for communication with Adobes significant stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Board believes that stockholders are best served by the Boards current leadership structure because it provides Adobe with the benefits of combining the leadership role of Chairman and Chief Executive Officer, while at the same time featuring a strong and empowered independent Lead Director who provides an effective independent voice and further enhances the contributions of our independent directors.

sentences.text: The Boards Role in Risk Oversight
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Risk assessment and oversight are an integral part of our governance and management processes.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Board takes an active role in reviewing Adobes corporate strategy and priorities on an ongoing basis, and also encourages management to promote a culture that actively manages risks as a part of Adobes corporate strategy and day-to-day business operations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Management discusses strategic and operational risks at regular management meetings, and conducts specific strategic planning and review sessions during the year that include a focused discussion and analysis of the risks facing Adobe.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Throughout the year, senior management reviews these risks with the Board at regular Board and committee meetings as part of management presentations that focus on particular business functions, operations or strategies, and presents the steps taken by management to mitigate or eliminate such risks.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board regularly provides management with input on these risks and mitigation steps.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Board does not have a standing risk management committee, but rather administers this oversight function directly through our Board as a whole, as well as through various standing committees of our Board that address risks inherent in their respective areas of oversight.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In particular, our Board is responsible for monitoring and assessing strategic risk exposure, and our Audit Committee has the responsibility to oversee our major financial risk exposures, cyber-security exposures and the steps our management has taken to monitor and control these exposures, as well as oversight of our enterprise risk management program.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee also monitors compliance with legal and regulatory requirements and oversees the performance of our internal audit function.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Nominating and Governance Committee monitors the effectiveness of our Corporate Governance Guidelines and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: approves or disapproves any related-

sentences.text: persons transactions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe in sound corporate governance practices and have adopted formal Corporate Governance Guidelines to enhance our effectiveness.

sentences.text: The Corporate Governance Guidelines set forth the practices our Board follows with respect to Board and committee composition and selection, Board meetings, Chief Executive Officer performance evaluation and management development and succession planning for senior management, including the Chief Executive Officer position.

sentences.text: It also provides an overview of our executive compensation philosophy, including our principal compensation programs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Finally, it analyzes how and why the Executive Compensation Committee of our Board (the Committee) made its compensation decisions for our executive officers, including our NEOs, in fiscal year 2016.

sentences.text: Fiscal Year 2016 Business Highlights
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Adobe continues to execute on its mission of changing the world through digital experiences with its best-in-class cloud businesses: Creative Cloud, Document Cloud, and Adobe Marketing Cloud.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In fiscal year 2016, the companys cloud strategies continued to produce strong results and steady, predictable growth, with approximately 82% of our revenue coming from recurring sources at the end of the year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In terms of financial results, our 2016 fiscal year was a record-breaking year for the company, in terms of revenues, earnings and operating cash flow.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For the fiscal year ended December 2, 2016:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Adobe achieved a record $5.85 billion in annual revenue, representing year-over-year growth of 22%;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Digital Media Annualized Recurring Revenue (ARR) grew to $4.01 billion, growing $1.13 billion during the fiscal year;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Adobe generated $2.20 billion in operating cash flow, representing 50% year-over-year growth;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Deferred revenue grew to an all-time high of $2.01 billion, and unbilled backlog grew to approximately $3.42 billion;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Adobe Marketing Cloud achieved a record $1.63 billion in annual revenue, representing 20% year-over-year growth;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Adobe repurchased 10.4 million shares during the year, returning approximately $1.01 billion of cash to stockholders; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The company reported annual GAAP diluted earnings per share of $2.32.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our executive officers also delivered on key strategic performance objectives established by the Committee for fiscal year 2016 and other corporate initiatives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition to producing strong financial results in fiscal year 2016, achievements included:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Continued broad leadership recognition in digital marketing, including Adobe Marketing Cloud being named the sole leader in the Digital Experience Platforms Wave report by Forrester Research and as a leader in Gartner Magic Quadrant for Digital Marketing Hubs;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Recognition as one of the Best Places to Work around the globe by a number of publications, including #9 on Glassdoors top 10 list for best places to work and #20 out of 50 on Glassdoors Highest Rated CEOs;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For the first time, being named to the Dow Jones Sustainability Index (DJSI) World - the gold standard of corporate responsibility reporting for the investor community and the only new software company added this year;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For the second year, being included on CR Magazines 100 Best Corporate Citizens List in recognition of our transparency in reporting and responsible business practices;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Receipt of a perfect score on the 2017 Corporate Equality Index report from the Human Rights Campaign Foundation;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Climbing to #63 on Interbrands 2016 list of Best 100 Global Brands;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2016 IEEE Spectrum patent rankings ranked Adobe #16 among software companies worldwide for patent portfolio size, strength, and quality; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Continued emphasis on key corporate social responsibility objectives as Adobe continues to impact our environment and our community, donating millions of dollars to charitable causes (directly and through the Adobe Foundation), and serving in the community through our employees, who contributed thousands of hours volunteering through pro bono initiatives and Adobe-sponsored programs.

sentences.text: Fiscal Year 2016 Compensation Highlights
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our executive compensation programs are designed to directly tie the outcomes of our incentive compensation awards for our executive officers to the achievement of our key strategic performance objectives and returns to our stockholders, and drive the creation of sustainable long-term stockholder value.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our fiscal year 2016 compensation programs reflected this philosophy, and compensation earned reflected our business achievements discussed above.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Cash Incentive Plan Redesign - As in previous years, the Committee continued to emphasize annualized recurring revenue and bookings in our 2016 executive cash bonus plan to drive growth in our strategic businesses.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee added additional strategic objectives to the corporate performance payout under the 2016 bonus plan in order to motivate our executives to achieve certain company priorities, such as driving customer value and more closely integrating Adobes cloud offerings.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Lastly, the Committee decided to place greater weight on individual performance in the bonus plan, increasing the individual performance component to 50% of each participants bonus opportunity.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Cash Incentive Plan Payout - Our financial and operational results were substantially in line with the high expectations our Executive Compensation Committee set for our NEOs at the outset of the fiscal year, including record ARR in our Digital Media business and strong net new bookings in our Adobe Marketing Cloud business.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, due to the rigor in our annual cash incentive plan, including the challenging strategic objective components discussed above, the Committee determined that the Corporate Performance Result under the plan was achieved at 84% of target, which accounts for half of each executives target bonus opportunity (for more discussion of cash awards, see the section captioned Cash Incentives below).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Performance Share Program Result - The three-year performance period under Adobes 2014 Performance Share Program closed at the end of our 2016 fiscal year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under this program, shares were earned based on relative total stockholder return (TSR) over a three-year performance period, during which Adobe achieved a total return of approximately 101%.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: With this performance, our percentile rank among the companies included in the NASDAQ 100 Index as of November 30, 2013 was approximately 89th, which under the plan resulted in each of the participants being awarded performance shares equal to 198% of the executives target number of shares.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Continued Emphasis on Pay for Performance - Approximately 88% of our CEOs target compensation in fiscal year 2016 was comprised of equity awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A substantial percentage (50%) of those awards are based on relative TSR (compared against companies included in the NASDAQ 100 Index) over a three-year performance period issued under our Performance Share Program, with the balance of equity value issued as time-based RSUs that vest annually over three years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This means that, unless we achieve the TSR performance objective of the Performance Share Program each year and over the long-term, our CEO and other executive officers will not realize the full potential value of their long-term incentive compensation.

sentences.text: Response to 2016 Say-on-Pay Vote and Stockholder Feedback
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Adobe values the input of our stockholders on our compensation programs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We hold an advisory vote on executive compensation on an annual basis.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We also regularly communicate with our stockholders to better understand their opinions on governance issues, including compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Executive Compensation Committee carefully considers stockholder feedback and the outcome of each vote when reviewing our executive compensation programs each year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At our 2016 annual stockholders meeting, over 90% of the votes cast approved, on an advisory basis, our NEO compensation and disclosures for fiscal year 2015.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This high percentage of votes in favor of our compensation approach validated the updates to our compensation programs in response to stockholder feedback received in previous years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In particular, we believe the strong approval was largely driven by the following attributes of our fiscal year 2015 executive compensation programs: (1) the three-year performance period under our Performance Share Program; (2) basing our Performance Share Program on a single objective metric relative TSRclosely aligning the compensation opportunity of our NEOs to long-term stockholder interests; (3) having a clawback policy applicable in the event of a material restatement of our financial statements (as described further below), and (4) basing our short-term cash incentive program on financial metrics that align with our growth strategy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: While we welcome stockholder interaction throughout the year, we generally engage in stockholder outreach during two key periods each fiscal year: (1) leading up to our annual meeting of stockholders, and (2) during the months of September and October, when Adobes management, Executive Compensation Committee and its independent compensation consultant are in the preliminary planning stages for the subsequent years compensation programs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: During 2016 we had strong engagement with several of our largest stockholders in discussions regarding our existing programs and potential changes for the future, and we value the input received
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: during those discussions.

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation Approach in Fiscal Year 2017
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition to taking stockholder feedback into account, the Committee has evaluated a number of other factors discussed below in making decisions about our executive compensation approach.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Following this evaluation, the Committee determined (1) to continue the general approach of our short-term cash incentive plan, with an update to the strategic objectives component to focus more specifically on customer retention and satisfaction, and (2) not to make changes to our equity compensation program for fiscal year 2017, continuing the approach from recent fiscal years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This program was designed to align with our three-year operating plan and the multi-year growth strategy of our Digital Media and Digital Marketing businesses as our executives guide Adobe through a planned period of significant growth.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee believes these programs have created the desired pay-for-performance incentives, and that these incentives have been driving the intended outcomes in recent fiscal years, resulting in company growth and generating significant stockholder value.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation Philosophy and Objectives
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Adobes vision is to change the world through digital experiences.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To support our product and technical innovation with strong execution, we strive to create a dynamic work environment that attracts and retains great people who drive successful business outcomes, growth, innovation and a focus on creating a world-class experience for Adobes customers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe that the skills, experience and dedication of our executive officers are critical factors that contribute directly to our operating results, thereby enhancing stockholder value.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In order to continue to develop and bring to market the products that drive our financial performance, we must attract, motivate, and retain the top talent within our industry.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As such, our compensation programs are designed: (1) to provide competitive compensation opportunities that attract, as needed, individuals with the skills necessary for us to achieve our business objectives and retain those top performing individuals; (2) to relate directly to our corporate performance and meaningfully drive our business objectives; (3) to reward and motivate strong individual performance, but with a substantial majority of compensation tied to corporate objectives; (4) to avoid undue compensation-related risk; and (5) to create direct alignment with our stockholders by providing equity ownership in the company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Further, the following aspects of our compensation program underscore our continued commitment to corporate governance and compensation best practices:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our executives total compensation is designed to pay for performance and is comprised of elements that address both short- term and long-term financial performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Insider Trading Policy, which applies to all employees, officers and directors of the company, prohibits transactions involving pledging, hedging or short sales of Adobe equity.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our officers at the senior vice president level and above are subject to substantial stock ownership guidelines.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We do not provide golden parachute excise tax gross-up payments.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We do not provide defined benefit pension plans, supplemental executive retirement plans or retiree health benefits.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We have a clawback policy for certain performance-based incentive compensation of our executive officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our equity plans do not include an evergreen feature that would automatically replenish the shares available for issuance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe our executive compensation programs have been effective at driving the achievement of our target financial and strategic results, appropriately aligning executive pay and corporate performance and enabling us to attract and retain top executives within our industry.

sentences.text: At the outset of 2016, the Committee approved the Fiscal Year 2016 Executive Annual Incentive Plan (the Executive Incentive Plan), which operates under the terms of a stockholder-approved 2016 Executive Cash Performance Bonus Plan, to provide cash compensation opportunities to our NEOs based on the companys achievement of pre-established performance goals.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee set threshold, target and maximum performance levels for these goals that were based on our Board-approved operating plan for fiscal year 2016 (the Operating Plan).

sentences.text: Plan Design and Target Annual Incentive Opportunity
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee set the target annual cash incentive opportunity for fiscal year 2016 (expressed as a percentage of base salary earned during the year) for each NEO early in the fiscal year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In setting the target levels, the Committee considered each NEOs fiscal year 2016 target total cash opportunity against the peer group data provided by our independent compensation consultant, internal pay equity and the roles and responsibilities of the NEOs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee set the fiscal year 2016 cash incentive targets for each of the NEOs at the same percentage as their target opportunities in fiscal year 2015.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee believes that the target annual cash incentive opportunity should make up a larger portion of an NEOs total target cash compensation as the executives level of responsibility increases.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As with our fiscal year 2015 program, the Executive Incentive Plan was designed to align our NEOs cash bonus incentives with the companys strategic priorities of driving financial performance based on ARR growth in Digital Media and net bookings growth (Bookings) in our Adobe Marketing Cloud.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Focusing our business on subscriptions and cloud-based services, such as Creative Cloud and Adobe Marketing Cloud, encourages our executives to continue to grow our recurring revenue streams.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As discussed in our recent Annual Reports, the Committee and the companys management feel that these metrics are the best indicators of the forward-looking health of Adobes business following our transition away from perpetual revenue (generally recognized at the time of sale), which has been largely replaced by subscription revenue that is generally recognized over time.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Portions of the cash opportunity for each NEO were also tied to goals related to unifying our cloud platforms and increasing the value we provide to our customers, as well as an individual goal component tailored to each executive.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Corporate Performance Result (expressed as a percentage) is the product of (1) Financial Performance and (2) Strategic Objectives.

sentences.text: The companys financial performance for the 2016 fiscal year performance period is determined by a metric comprised of both (1) net new Digital Media ARR and (2) Bookings for the Adobe Marketing Cloud, in both cases as set forth in the Operating Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As described in our Annual Report on Form 10-K for the fiscal year ended December 2, 2016, we define annualized recurring revenue, or ARR, in our Digital Media business as the sum of Creative ARR and Document Cloud ARR.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We define Creative ARR as the sum of (1) the annual value of Creative Cloud subscriptions and services, plus (2) the annual contract value of Digital Publishing Suite, plus (3) the annual contract value of Creative Enterprise Term License Agreements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We define Document Cloud ARR as the sum of (1) the annual value of Document Cloud subscriptions and services, plus (2) the annual contract value of Document Cloud Enterprise Term License Agreements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Bookings target for Adobe Marketing Cloud is also based on the target set forth in the Operating Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Financial Performance measures net new ARR in our Digital Media business and Bookings for Adobe Marketing Cloud on a combined basis, with the actual percentage of Financial Performance achievement determining the Financial Performance payout percentage (with a maximum achievement of 200%).

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As with our 2015 Performance Share Program, under our 2016 Performance Share Program shares are earned based on a single objective financial measurerelative TSR over a three-year performance period.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All earned performance share awards will vest upon the later of the Committees certification of results and the three-year anniversary of the grant date.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Accordingly, the performance shares will align our NEOs interests with those of our stockholders over the long term, while also providing key retention incentives, as the shares will only be awarded if an NEO remains providing service to Adobe (or an affiliate) upon the date of the Committees certification of results following the end of the three-year performance period.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Moreover, the design of our Performance Share Program will result in strengthened retention incentives for our executives during periods over which the company is delivering favorable returns to our investors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee believes in the importance of balancing absolute performance with that of relative performance to ensure that the company performs well relative to benchmark companies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under the 2016 Performance Share Program, the participants can earn between 0% and 200% (the payout cap under our program) of the target amount of performance shares.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The three-year TSR measure compares the TSR of our common stock against the TSR of the companies included in the NASDAQ 100 Index as of November 27, 2015, using a cumulative 90 calendar day look- back as of the beginning and the end of the three-year period.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This TSR metric creates accountability since the payout depends upon our stockholder return being better than other companies in the NASDAQ 100 Index, companies the Committee and Adobes management believe constitute the most relevant market benchmark for Adobes performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Also, the NASDAQ 100 (as opposed to our peer group) is broad enough to accommodate the high amount of consolidation and acquisition in our industry sector without significantly impacting the overall makeup of comparative companies between the start and end of the performance period.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The number of performance shares awarded will increase or decrease 2.5% for every percentile that Adobes TSR percentile rank is above or below, respectively, the NASDAQ 100 companies 50th percentile, and no shares will be awarded if our performance ranks below the 25th percentile for the three-year performance period.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Additionally, regardless of our relative position with respect to the NASDAQ 100 companies, the award will be capped at 100% of target in the case of Adobe having a negative absolute TSR over the measurement period.

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Realizable pay reflects the real value of equity awards and increases or decreases with fluctuations in market value.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: When determining the annual equity grants to our executives in January of each year, the Committee believes it is important to take into account not only the grant date values included in our Summary Compensation Table, but also to consider the effect of the value of our stock on those awards at the end of our fiscal year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Given that approximately 88% of our CEOs and 80% of our other NEOs target pay is equity based, the Committee and the company consider it especially important to focus on realizable pay when evaluating pay for performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For example, decreases in our stock price could cause stock-based awards to have realizable values that are less than what was targeted at the time of grant, including performance periods under our Performance Share Programs potentially closing with no value earned and no dilutive effect to the company.

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Adobes Board adopted a Clawback Policy applicable in the event of a material restatement of our financial statements that results from the intentional misconduct or fraud of a Section 16 executive officer.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Clawback Policy enables the Board to require repayment or cancellation of the incremental portion of the performance-based incentive compensation paid or payable to such officer in excess of the amount that would have been paid or payable based on the restated financial results.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We will also continue to monitor rule-making actions of the SEC and NASDAQ related to clawback policies and implement such rules when required.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, as a public company subject to Section 304 of the Sarbanes-Oxley Act of 2002, if we are required to restate our financial results as the result of misconduct or due to our material noncompliance with any financial reporting requirements under the federal securities laws, our CEO and CFO may be legally required to reimburse us for any bonus or incentive-based or equity-based compensation they receive.

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Adobe has adopted written guidelines setting forth our grant practices and procedures for all equity awards.

sentences.text: Pursuant to these guidelines:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: the vesting commencement date for our annual equity awards granted to our employees, including the NEOs, is January 24 of each year, or the first trading day thereafter, unless another date is approved and documented by the Committee;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: the effective grant date for executive officer new hire RSU and performance share awards is the executive officers hire date (subject to compliance with Section 162(m), as deemed advisable by the Committee); and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: the effective grant date for non-executive officer new hire stock option, performance share and RSU awards is the 15th day of the month following the month of the employees hire date, or, if that is not a trading day, the first trading day thereafter.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Because the grant dates are pre-established, the timing of the release of material non-public information does not affect the grant dates for equity awards, and Adobe does not time the release of material non-public information based on equity award grant dates.

sentences.text: The Committee approves all grants made to our executive officers on or before the grant date.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Board has also delegated to a Management Committee for Employee Equity Awards (consisting of the Chief Executive Officer and the Executive Vice President, Customer & Employee Experience) the authority to approve RSU awards to non-executive officer employees in accordance with the granting guidelines described above and subject to Committee-approved vesting schedules and share limits.

sentences.text: Severance and Change of Control Compensation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee believes that change of control vesting and severance benefits, if structured appropriately, serve to minimize the distraction caused by a potential transaction and reduce the risk that an executive departs Adobe before an acquisition is consummated.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee and the company believe that a pre-existing plan will allow our executives to focus on continuing normal business operations and on the success of a potential business combination, rather than on seeking alternative employment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Further, a pre-existing plan ensures stability and will enable our executives to maintain a balanced perspective in making overall business decisions during a potentially uncertain period.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To that end, Adobe provides certain change of control benefits as described below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each of our NEOs is an eligible participant in our 2014 Executive Severance Plan in the Event of a Change of Control (the Change of Control Plan).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Change of Control Plan provides for severance payments and fully accelerated vesting of outstanding equity awards for our NEOs and other members of senior management upon an involuntary termination of employment upon or following a qualifying change of control.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The terms of the Change of Control Plan are described below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We also maintain a Retention Agreement with Mr. Narayen, which provides similar benefits but does not require termination of his employment in order for him to receive the equity acceleration, as described below under Executive CompensationChange of Control.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Narayens original Retention Agreement, dated January 12, 1998, was amended February 11, 2008 based on his promotion to Chief Executive Officer, and was further amended on December 11, 2010 and December 5, 2014 in order to clarify the manner of compliance with, or exemption from, Internal Revenue Code Section 409A.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Change of Control Plan and the Retention Agreement with Mr. Narayen do not provide for reimbursements or gross- ups of excise tax amounts under Section 4999 of the Code.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Rather, under both of these arrangements, benefits would be reduced if doing so would result in a better after-tax economic position for the affected executive.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee and the company believe this is an appropriate allocation of the tax cost of these arrangements between Adobe and the executive and is consistent with market practice.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our change of control arrangements are designed to be competitive with the pay practices of our peer group.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee periodically reviews the terms and conditions of our change of control arrangements and will make adjustments when and to the extent it deems appropriate.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Change of Control Plan will expire on December 13, 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Role of Our Executive Compensation Committee, External Compensation Consultant and Management
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Executive Compensation Committee oversees and provides strategic direction to management regarding many elements of our executive compensation programs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: It reviews and approves the compensation and severance benefits of Adobes executive officers, including our NEOs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As part of this review, the Committee regularly solicits input from its independent compensation consultant.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In fiscal year 2016, the Committee met regularly in executive session with its independent compensation consultant and without management present.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Chair of the Committee also met separately with the consultant, both with and without management present.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee has the authority to obtain independent advice and assistance from internal or external legal, accounting and other advisors, at Adobes expense.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee also discusses Mr. Narayens performance with the Board and remains solely responsible for making the final decisions on compensation for our executive officers, including our NEOs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Executive Compensation Committee regularly reviews the compensation programs for our executive officers, including our NEOs, to ensure they achieve the desired goal of aligning our executive compensation structure with our stockholders interests.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This includes using our incentive compensation awards to support our strategic and operating plans.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As discussed above, we also closely monitor the compensation programs and pay levels of executives from companies of similar size and complexity, so that we may ensure that our compensation programs are within the norm of market practices.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This aids in the retention of our NEOs in a competitive market for executive talent.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Since 2008, the Executive Compensation Committee has engaged Compensia to review and provide independent advice concerning all of the components of Adobes executive compensation program, on account of Compensias expertise in the software industry, its knowledge of our peer group, and its geographical proximity, enabling frequent in-person attendance at Committee meetings.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensia provided the following services on behalf of the Committee during fiscal year 2016: (1) reviewed and provided recommendations on the composition of our peer group, and provided compensation data relating to executives at the selected companies in our peer group; (2) conducted a comprehensive review of the total compensation arrangements for all of our executive officers; (3) provided advice on our executive officers compensation; (4) assisted with executive equity program design, including analysis of equity mix and target grant levels; (5) assisted with review of our fiscal year 2016 equity program and Executive Annual Incentive Plan; (6) provided updates on NASDAQ listing standards, Say-on-Pay results, and Dodd-Frank regulatory developments; (7) conducted a comprehensive review of compensation paid to the Board and provided recommendations to the Committee and the Board regarding director pay; (8) updated the Committee on emerging trends and best practices in the area of executive and board compensation; (9) provided advice on stock ownership guidelines for executive officers and directors; and (10) reviewed the Compensation Discussion and Analysis for inclusion in our 2016 proxy statement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee conducted a formal review of Compensias independence and is satisfied with the qualifications, performance and independence of Compensia.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Other than providing limited guidance to our Employee Experience department regarding Adobes broad-based equity compensation design for all employees (as approved by the Committee), Compensia does not provide any other services to Adobe.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Adobe pays for the cost of Compensias services.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Employee Experience, Finance and Legal departments work with our Chief Executive Officer and Compensia to design and develop new compensation programs applicable to our NEOs and other executive officers, to recommend changes to existing compensation programs, to recommend financial and other performance targets to be achieved under those programs, to prepare analyses of financial data, to prepare peer group compensation comparisons and other Committee briefing materials and, ultimately, to implement the decisions of the Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Members of these departments and our Chief Executive Officer also meet with Compensia separately from the Committee to convey information on proposals that management may make to the Committee, as well as to allow Compensia to collect information about Adobe to develop its own proposals.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, our Chief Executive Officer conducted reviews of the performance and compensation of the other NEOs, and based on these reviews, made his recommendations for fiscal year 2016 target compensation levels (including adjustments to base salary and target cash and equity incentive levels) directly to the Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No NEO was present or participated in the final determinations or deliberations of the Committee regarding the amount of any component of his own fiscal year 2016 compensation package.

sentences.text: Tax and Accounting Considerations
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In designing our compensation programs, the Committee considers the financial accounting and tax consequences to Adobe as well as the tax consequences to our employees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In determining the aggregate number and mix of equity grants in any fiscal year, the Committee and management consider the size and share-based compensation expense of the outstanding and new equity awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Section 162(m) of the Code generally disallows a tax deduction to public corporations for compensation greater than $1 million paid for any fiscal year to the corporations Chief Executive Officer and the three other most highly compensated executive officers as of the end of any fiscal year, other than the Chief Financial Officer.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, certain types of performance-based compensation are excluded from the $1 million deduction limit if specific requirements are met.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee considers the impact of Section 162(m) when designing our executive compensation programs and structured our Executive Incentive Plan, stock plans and performance share programs so that a number of awards may be granted under these plans and programs in a manner that complies with the requirements imposed by Section 162(m).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Tax deductibility is not the primary factor used by the Committee in setting compensation, however, and corporate objectives may not necessarily align with the requirements for full deductibility under Section 162(m).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe it is important to preserve flexibility in administering compensation programs as corporate objectives may not always be consistent with the requirements for full deductibility.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, the Committee has granted and may continue to grant awards, such as time-based RSU awards and one-time discretionary cash awards under which payments may not be deductible under Section 162(m) when it determines that such non-deductible arrangements are otherwise in the best interests of Adobe and its stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, due to the ambiguities and uncertainties as to the application of Section 162(m), no assurances can be given that compensation intended by the Committee to satisfy the requirements for deductibility under Section 162(m) would, in fact, do so.

sentences.text: Nonqualified Deferred Compensation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We originally adopted a Deferred Compensation Plan in December 2006, which has been amended from time to time and most recently in November 2014.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under the terms of our Deferred Compensation Plan, eligible employees, including each of the NEOs, and directors may elect to defer the receipt of a portion of cash and equity compensation they would otherwise have received when earned.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Amounts deferred under the Deferred Compensation Plan are deemed invested in the investment funds selected by the participant with similar options as available under the Adobe 401(k) Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We do not contribute to the Deferred Compensation Plan on behalf of its participants, or match the deferrals made by participants, with the exception of situations in which an election to defer under the Deferred Compensation Plan would prevent a participant from receiving the full 401(k) company match.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In those situations, we make a contribution to the Deferred Compensation Plan equal to the foregone 401(k) company match.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Accordingly, amounts payable under the Deferred Compensation Plan generally are entirely determined by participant contributions and fund elections.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Employee participants in the Deferred Compensation Plan may elect to contribute 5% to 75% of their base salary and 5% to 100% of other specified compensation, including commissions and bonuses.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Participants may also contribute 100% per vesting tranche of their RSU and performance share awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Generally, participants may elect the payment of benefits with respect to cash and equity deferrals to begin on a specified date or upon termination of employment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Payment of cash deferrals may be made in the form of a lump sum or annual installments, subject to certain requirements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Payments of equity deferrals may only be made in the form of a lump sum.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, each participant shall elect whether to keep his or her account balance in the Deferred Compensation Plan or to receive a lump sum distribution upon a change of control.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If a participant experiences an unforeseeable emergency during the deferral period, the participant may petition to receive a partial or full payout from the Deferred Compensation Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All distributions are made in cash, except that deferred RSUs and performance shares are settled in Adobe stock.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Other than Mr. Narayen, no other NEOs participated in, or had an accrued balance under, the Deferred Compensation Plan in fiscal year 2016.

sentences.text: Compensation Philosophy
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The general philosophy of our Board is that compensation for non-employee directors should be a mix of cash and equity- based compensation to reward them for a year of service, payable quarterly, in fulfilling their oversight responsibilities.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Adobe does not compensate its management director (our Chief Executive Officer) for Board service in addition to his regular employee compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Decisions regarding the non-employee director compensation program are approved by our full Board based on recommendations by the Executive Compensation Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In making such recommendations, the Committee evaluates the appropriate level and form of compensation for non-employee directors and considers potential changes, if any.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee considers advice from Compensia, when appropriate, including consideration of the director compensation practices of peer companies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee also considers the extent to which our Board compensation practices align with the interests of our stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Board reviews the Executive Compensation Committees recommendations and then determines the amount of director compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee reviews the total compensation of our non-employee directors and each element of our director compensation program annually.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At the Committees direction, Compensia analyzes the competitive position of our
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: director compensation program against the peer group used to benchmark executive compensation and examines how director compensation levels, practices and design features compare to members of the peer group.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensias analysis in fiscal 2016 showed that overall compensation for non-employee directors was near the peer median, on a per-director basis, which is in line with our target positioning.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As a result, the Committee recommended, and our Board approved, making no changes to our director compensation program for fiscal 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Additionally, during fiscal year 2016 our Board amended the 2003 Plan in order to limit the total amount of compensation payable to any non-employee director to $1,500,000 for any fiscal year (including both cash and equity-based compensation).
